intro: Boerhavia erecta f. subepunctata, commonly known as the spiked spurges, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its erect growth habit and distinctive, spiny stems. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are typically ovate or elliptic with a slightly hairy surface. It is often found in disturbed soils and thrives in sunny, well-drained environments.
